data.event: A man about to be indicted by the United States Department of Justice died Tuesday.
Bruce Edwards Ivins, 62, was taken to Frederick Memorial Hospital in Frederick, Maryland, where he died of an overdose of Tylenol and codeine, the Los Angeles Times reported Friday.

event.title: worked at the biodefense laboratories in Fort Detrick, Maryland for 18 years

data.event: Ivins, who worked at the biodefense laboratories in Fort Detrick, Maryland for 18 years, was about to be charged by the Justice Department in connection with the 2001 anthrax attacks, which killed five people and infected 17 others.

event.title: six years, Dr. Ivins fully cooperated

data.event: "For six years, Dr. Ivins fully cooperated with that investigation, assisting the government in every way that was asked of him," Mr. Kemp told the New York Times.

event.title: psychiatric treatment within the last month

data.event: The New York Times reports that Ivins had been undergoing psychiatric treatment within the last month and had a restraining order placed on him by a woman he was allegedly stalking and threatening.
